in conclusion the results arrived at in
this chapter may be summed up as follows
the stability of a faculty in an
individual depends upon its age in the
race
the older the faculty the more stable it
is and the less old the less stable
the race whose evolution is most rapid
will be the most subject of breakdown
the functions in any given race whose
evolutions are the most rapid
will be the most subject to break down
in the more progressive families of the
aryan race the mental faculties have had
for some millennium
past developed with great rapidity in

evolution of those faculties in that
